meanings.definition: Make a shrill, high-pitched sound like a bird or small mammal.
meanings.sent1: The little bird chirres happily in the tree.
meanings.sent2: She chirres to call her cat back home.
meanings.sent3: The chirres of the squirrel made the forest feel alive.
meanings.sent4: The wind chirres through the leaves like a whispering secret.
meanings.sent5: The chirres of the crickets filled the night with music.

meanings.definition: The act of making a chirping noise.
meanings.sent1: I love waking up to the chirres of the birds outside.
meanings.sent2: The chirres of the insects create a peaceful background noise.
meanings.sent3: The chirres of the chipmunks sounded like a tiny orchestra.
meanings.sent4: The chirres of the baby chicks were a delightful melody.
meanings.sent5: The chirres of the forest creatures blended into a harmonious symphony.
